fusion_models package

Fusion models: one py file per model

Submodules

fusion_models.base_pl_model module

Base lightning module for all fusion models and parent class for all fusion models.

class fusion_models.base_pl_model.BaseModel(model)[source]

Bases: LightningModule

Base model for all fusion models

model

Fusion model class.

Type:

class

pred_type

Type of prediction to be made. Options: binary, multiclass, regression.

Type:

str

multiclass_dim

Number of classes for multiclass prediction.

Type:

int

fusion_type

Type of fusion to be used. Options: early, late, graph.

Type:

str

kfold_flag

Whether to use k-fold cross validation.

Type:

bool

modality_type

Type of modality fusion to be used. Options: operation, subspace, graph, tensor, attention, Uni-modal

Type:

str

method_name

Name of the method.

Type:

str

subspace_method

Subspace method to be used - specific to the subspace fusion method

Type:

str

graph_maker

Graph maker to be used - specific to the graph fusion method

Type:

str

params

Dictionary of parameters.

Type:

dict

train_mask

Mask for training data - used for the graph fusion methods

Type:

tensor

val_mask

Mask for validation data - used for the graph fusion methods

Type:

tensor

loss_functions

Dictionary of loss functions.

Type:

dict

output_activation_functions

Dictionary of output activation functions.

Type:

dict

metrics

Dictionary of metrics.

Type:

dict

Dictionary of evaluation plots.

Type:

dict

kfold_plots

Dictionary of k-fold plots.

Type:

dict

get_data_from_batch(batch, train=True)[source]

Get data from batch.

Parameters:

  • batch (tensor) – Batch of data.

  • train (bool) – Whether the data is training data.

Returns:

  • x (tensor) – Input data.

  • y (tensor) – Labels.

get_model_outputs(x)[source]

Get model outputs.

Parameters:

x (tensor) – Input data.

Returns:

  • logits (tensor) – Logits.

  • reconstructions (tensor) –

    Reconstructions (returned if the model has a custom loss function such as a subspace

    method)

  • note

  • if you get an error here, check that the forward output is [out,] or [out, reconstructions]

get_model_outputs_and_loss(x, y, train=True)[source]

Get model outputs and loss.

Parameters:

  • x (tensor) – Input data.

  • y (tensor) – Labels.

Returns:

  • loss (tensor) – Loss.

  • end_output (tensor) – Final output.

  • logits (tensor) – Logits.

tensor

training: bool
training_step(batch, batch_idx)[source]

Training step.

Parameters:

  • batch (tensor) – Batch of data.

  • batch_idx (int) – Batch index.

Returns:

loss – Loss.

Return type:

tensor

validation_epoch_end(outputs)[source]

Gets the final validation epoch outputs and metrics. When metrics are calculated at the validation step and logged on on_epoch=True, the batch metrics are averaged. However, some metrics don’t average well (e.g. R2). Therefore, we’re calculating the final validation metrics here on the full validation set.

validation_step(batch, batch_idx)[source]

Validation step.

Parameters:

  • batch (tensor) – Batch of data.

  • batch_idx (int) – Batch index.

Return type:

None

class fusion_models.base_pl_model.ParentFusionModel(pred_type, data_dims, params)[source]

Bases: object

Parent class for all fusion models.

pred_type

Type of prediction to be made. Options: binary, multiclass, regression.

Type:

str

data_dims

List of data dimensions.

Type:

list

mod1_dim

Dimension of modality 1.

Type:

int

mod2_dim

Dimension of modality 2.

Type:

int

img_dim

Dimensions of image modality. If using 2D images, then the dimensions will be (x, y). If using 3D images, then the dimensions will be (x, y, z).

Type:

tuple

params

Dictionary of parameters.

Type:

dict

multiclass_dim

Number of classes for multiclass prediction.

Type:

int

kfold_flag

Whether to use k-fold cross validation.

Type:

bool

Set final prediction layers.

Set layers for modality 2.

Set layers for image modality.

set_fused_layers(fused_dim)[source]

Set layers for fused modality.

set_final_pred_layers(input_dim=64)[source]

Set final prediction layers.

Parameters:

input_dim (int) – Input dimension to final layers - may depend on fusion configuration.

Return type:

None

set_fused_layers(fused_dim)[source]

Set layers for fused modality

Parameters:

fused_dim (int) –

Dimension of fused modality: how many features are there after fusion?
e.g. if we have 2 modalities with 64 features each, and the fusion method

was concatenation, the fused_dim would be 128

Return type:

None

set_img_layers()[source]

Set layers for image modality. If using 2D images, then the layers will use Conv2D layers. If using 3D images, then the layers will use Conv3D layers.

Parameters:

None –

Return type:

None

Parameters:

None –

Return type:

fusion_models.concat_img_latent_tab_doubleloss module

Concat image latent space with tabular data, trained altogether with a custom loss function: MSE + BCE.

class fusion_models.concat_img_latent_tab_doubleloss.ConcatImgLatentTabDoubleLoss(pred_type, data_dims, params)[source]

Bases: ParentFusionModel, Module

Concatenating image latent space with tabular data, trained altogether with a custom loss function: MSE + BCE.

method_name

Name of the method.

Type:

str

modality_type

Type of modality.

Type:

str

Type of fusion.

str

Type of prediction to be performed.

Type:

str

Dictionary containing the layers of the image data.

Type:

dict

fused_layers

Sequential layer containing the fused layers.

Type:

nn.Sequential

final_prediction
Sequential layer containing the final prediction layers. The final prediction layers

take in the number of features of the fused layers as input.

Type:

nn.Sequential

custom_loss

Additional loss function to be used for training the model.

Type:

nn.Module

latent_size

Size of the latent space.

Type:

int

Sequential layer containing the encoder layers.

Type:

nn.Sequential

Sequential layer containing the decoder layers.

Type:

nn.Sequential

fc1

nn.Linear

Return type:

list

fusion_type = 'subspace'
method_name = 'Concatenating image latent space with tabular data, trained altogether'
modality_type = 'tab_img'
training: bool

fusion_models.concat_img_latent_tab_doubletrain module

Concatenating the latent img space and tabular data. The latent image space is trained separately from both the tabular data and the labels, using the img_latent_subspace_method class.

class fusion_models.concat_img_latent_tab_doubletrain.ConcatImgLatentTabDoubleTrain(pred_type, data_dims, params)[source]

Bases: ParentFusionModel, Module

Concatenating the latent img space and tabular data. The latent image space is trained separately from both the tabular data and the labels, using the img_latent_subspace_method class.

Name of the method.

Type:

str

modality_type

class

Dimension of the latent image space once we shrink it down.

Type:

int

Linear layer to reduce the dimension of the latent image space.

Type:

nn.Linear

Dimension of the fused layers.

int

  • val_dataset (Dataset) – Validation dataset.

fusion_models.crossmodal_att module

Crossmodal multi-head attention model. This model uses the self attention and cross modal attention between the two modalities: tabular and image.

class fusion_models.crossmodal_att.CrossmodalMultiheadAttention(pred_type, data_dims, params)[source]

Bases: ParentFusionModel, Module

Crossmodal multi-head attention model. This model uses the self attention and cross modal attention between the two modalities: tabular and image.

method_name

Name of the method.

Type:

str

modality_type

Type of modality.

Type:

str

fusion_type

Type of fusion.

Type:

str

pred_type

Type of prediction to be performed.

Type:

str

mod1_layers

Dictionary containing the layers of the first modality.

Type:

dict

img_layers

Dictionary containing the layers of the image data.

Type:

dict

fused_layers

Sequential layer containing the fused layers.

Type:

nn.Sequential

attention

Multihead attention layer. Takes in 50 features as input.

Type:

nn.MultiheadAttention

img_dense

Linear layer. Takes in 50 features as input. This is the output of the multihead attention layer.

Type:

nn.Linear

to50

Linear layer. Takes in the number of features of the fused layers as input.

Type:

nn.Linear

relu

ReLU activation function.

Type:

nn.ReLU

tab1drops

List containing the dropout layers for the tabular modality.

Type:

list

final_prediction

Sequential layer containing the final prediction layers. The final prediction layers take in 200 features.

Type:

nn.Sequential

forward(x)[source]

Forward pass of the model.

References

Golovanevsky, M., Eickhoff, C., & Singh, R. (2022). Multimodal attention-based deep learning for Alzheimer’s disease diagnosis. Journal of the American Medical Informatics Association, 29(12), 2014–2022. https://doi.org/10.1093/jamia/ocac168

https://github.com/rsinghlab/MADDi/blob/main/training/train_all_modalities.py

fusion_models.edge_corr_gnn module

Edge correlation GNN model.

class fusion_models.edge_corr_gnn.EdgeCorrGNN(pred_type, data_dims, params)[source]

Bases: ParentFusionModel, Module

Graph neural network with the edge weighting as the first tabular modality correlations and the node features as the second tabular modality features.

method_name

Name of the method.

Type:

str

modality_type

Type of modality.

Type:

str

fusion_type

Type of fusion.

Type:

str

graph_maker

Function that creates the graph data structure.

Type:

function

conv1

Graph convolutional layer. The first layer takes in the number of features of the second tabular modality as input.

Type:

GCNConv

conv2

Graph convolutional layer. The second layer takes in 64 features as input.

Type:

GCNConv

conv3

Graph convolutional layer. The third layer takes in 128 features as input.

Type:

GCNConv

conv4

Graph convolutional layer. The fourth layer takes in 256 features as input.

Type:

GCNConv

final_prediction

Sequential layer containing the final prediction layers. The final prediction layers take in 256 features.

Type:

nn.Sequential

forward(x)[source]

Forward pass of the model.

forward(x)[source]

Forward pass of the model.

Parameters:

x (torch.Tensor) – Tensor containing the tabular data.

Returns:

List containing the output of the model.

Return type:

list

fusion_type = 'graph'
method_name = 'Edge Correlation GNN'
modality_type = 'both_tab'
training: bool

fusion_models.img_tab_channelwise_att module

Image-channel-wise attention fusion model.

class fusion_models.img_tab_channelwise_att.ImageChannelWiseMultiAttention(pred_type, data_dims, params)[source]

Bases: ParentFusionModel, Module

Channel-wise multiplication net (MRI)

Inspired by the work of Duanmu et al. (2020) [1]., we use channel-wise multiplication to combine tabular data and image data.

method_name

Name of the method.

Type:

str

modality_type

Type of modality.

Type:

str

fusion_type

Type of fusion.

Type:

str

mod1_layers

Dictionary containing the layers of the 1st type of tabular data.

Type:

dict

img_layers

Dictionary containing the layers of the image data.

Type:

dict

fused_layers

Sequential layer containing the fused layers.

Type:

nn.Sequential

final_prediction

Sequential layer containing the final prediction layers.

Type:

nn.Sequential

forward(x)[source]

Forward pass of the model.

References

Duanmu, H., Huang, P. B., Brahmavar, S., Lin, S., Ren, T., Kong, J., Wang, F., & Duong, T. Q. (2020). Prediction of Pathological Complete Response to Neoadjuvant Chemotherapy in Breast Cancer Using Deep Learning with Integrative Imaging, Molecular and Demographic Data. In A.

  1. Martel, P. Abolmaesumi,

D. Stoyanov, D. Mateus, M. A. Zuluaga, S. K. Zhou, D. Racoceanu, & L. Joskowicz (Eds.), Medical Image Computing and Computer Assisted Intervention – MICCAI 2020 (pp. 242–252). Springer International Publishing. https://doi.org/10.1007/978-3-030-59713-9_24

Accompanying code: (our model is inspired by the work of Duanmu et al. (2020) [1]) https://github.com/HongyiDuanmu26/Prediction-of-pCR-with-Integrative-Deep-Learning/ blob/main/CustomNet.py

fusion_models.mcvae_tab module

This module implements the MCVAE (multi-channel variational autoencoder) model for fusing two types of tabular data.

class fusion_models.mcvae_tab.MCVAE_tab(pred_type, data_dims, params)[source]

Bases: ParentFusionModel, Module

This class implements a model that fuses the two types of tabular data using the MCVAE approach. MCVAE: multi-channel variational autoencoder.

The MCVAE creates a joint latent space of the two types of tabular data based off a joint latent prior and joint decoding.

method_name

Name of the method.

Type:

str

modality_type

Type of modality.

Type:

str

fusion_type

Type of fusion.

Type:

str

subspace_method

Class of the subspace method.

Type:

class

mod1_layers

Dictionary containing the layers of the 1st type of tabular data. Here the first type of tabular data is the joint latent space created

in the mcvae_subspace_method class.

Type:

dict

fused_layers

Sequential layer containing the fused layers.

Type:

nn.Sequential

final_prediction

Sequential layer containing the final prediction layers.

Type:

nn.Sequential

forward(x)[source]

Forward pass of the model.

References

Antelmi, L., Ayache, N., Robert, P., & Lorenzi, M. (2019). Sparse Multi-Channel Variational

Autoencoder for the Joint Analysis of Heterogeneous Data. Proceedings of the 36th International Conference on Machine Learning, 302–311. https://proceedings.mlr.press/v97/antelmi19a.html

forward(x)[source]

Forward pass of the model.

Parameters:

x (list) – List containing the two types of tabular data.

Returns:

out_pred – List containing the predictions.

Return type:

list

fusion_type = 'subspace'
method_name = 'MCVAE Tabular'
modality_type = 'both_tab'
training: bool
fusion_models.mcvae_tab.mcvae_early_stopping_tol(patience, tolerance, loss_logs, verbose=False)[source]

Simple early stopping function for the MCVAE model’s training.

Parameters:

  • patience (int) – Number of epochs to wait before stopping

  • tolerance (int) – Tolerance for loss

  • loss_logs (list) – List of loss logs

  • verbose (bool) – Whether to print out information

Returns:

i – Epoch to stop at

Return type:

int

Gets the latent representations of the multimodal dataset. The two latent spaces are averaged to form the joint latent space.

Parameters:

Returns:

  • val_dataset (list, optional) – List containing the two types of tabular data, by default None

Returns:

  • labels (pd.DataFrame) – Dataframe containing the labels of the dataset.

fusion_models.tab_crossmodal_att module

Crossmodal multi-head attention for tabular data.

class fusion_models.tab_crossmodal_att.TabularCrossmodalMultiheadAttention(pred_type, data_dims, params)[source]

Bases: ParentFusionModel, Module

This class implements a model that fuses the two types of tabular data using a

cross-modal multi-head attention approach.

Inspired by the work of Golovanevsky et al. (2021) [1]: here we use two types of tabular data as the multi-modal data instead of 3 types in the paper.

method_name

Name of the method.

Type:

str

modality_type

Type of modality.

Type:

str

fusion_type

Type of fusion.

Type:

str

mod1_layers

Dictionary containing the layers of the 1st type of tabular data.

Type:

dict

mod2_layers

Dictionary containing the layers of the 2nd type of tabular data.

Type:

dict

fused_layers

Sequential layer containing the fused layers.

Type:

nn.Sequential

final_prediction

Sequential layer containing the final prediction layers.

Type:

nn.Sequential

fused_dim

Dimension of the fused layer.

Type:

int

attention

Multi-head attention layer.

Type:

nn.MultiheadAttention

to50

Linear layer to reduce the dimension of the data to 50.

Type:

nn.Linear

relu

ReLU activation function.

Type:

nn.ReLU

clindrops

List containing the dropout layers.

Type:

list

forward(x)[source]

Forward pass of the model.

References

Golovanevsky, M., Eickhoff, C., & Singh, R. (2022). Multimodal attention-based deep learning for Alzheimer’s disease diagnosis. Journal of the American Medical Informatics Association, 29(12), 2014–2022. https://doi.org/10.1093/jamia/ocac168

Accompanying code: (our model is inspired by the work of Golovanevsky et al. (2021) [1]) https://github.com/rsinghlab/MADDi/blob/main/training/train_all_modalities.py

forward(x)[source]

Forward pass of the model.

Parameters:

x (list) – List containing the input data.

Returns:

List containing the output of the model.

Return type:

list

method_name = 'Tabular Crossmodal multi-head attention'
modality_type = 'both_tab'

fusion_models.tabular_channelwise_att module

Channel-wise multiplication fusion model for tabular data.

class fusion_models.tabular_channelwise_att.TabularChannelWiseMultiAttention(pred_type, data_dims, params)[source]

Bases: ParentFusionModel, Module

This class implements a model that fuses the two types of tabular data using a

channel-wise multiplication approach.

Inspired by the work of Duanmu et al. (2020) [1]: here we use two types of tabular data as the multi-modal data instead of image and non-image like in the paper.

method_name

Name of the method.

Type:

str

modality_type

Type of modality.

Type:

str

str

nn.Sequential

nn.Sequential

References

& Duong, T. Q. (2020).

Prediction of Pathological Complete Response to Neoadjuvant Chemotherapy in Breast

Cancer Using Deep

Learning with Integrative Imaging, Molecular and Demographic Data. In A. L. Martel,

D. Stoyanov, D. Mateus, M. A. Zuluaga, S. K. Zhou, D. Racoceanu, & L. Joskowicz (Eds.), Medical Image Computing and Computer Assisted Intervention – MICCAI 2020 (pp. 242–252). Springer International Publishing. https://doi.org/10.1007/978-3-030-59713-9_24
